pullRequest.title: fix(broker): Log Invalid Static Config When Detected
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
This change is to log the differences for the static
configuration and local configuration. Only the
values checked in isStaticConfigValid are logged.
Related issues

closes #5394

nodes.bodyText: Since this is not really a different error than the error log statement at line 191, I'd prefer to see these log statements combined into a single statement. Otherwise our error tooling for pick it up as 2 separate errors.
Please change this such that it states that node id should be >= 0 and < localBroker.getClusterSize()

I like that you spend effort on making the entire statement human readable such that we can easily find the diff, but multi error log statements are generally not well received by error tooling. It would be great if you could find a way to get everything on one line, but still in a human readable format in which we can easily find the diff.

nodes.bodyText:
I ran a little manual test, by changing the above if statement to always evaluate to true, locally building the project and running ./dist/target/zeebe-broker/bin/broker. It outputted the following log statement:
2020-10-12 10:44:49.002 [] [atomix-cluster-events] ERROR io.zeebe.broker.clustering - Static configuration of node 0 differs from local node 0.NodeId: 0 <= 0 < 1, ClusterSize: 1 == 1, PartitionsCount: 1 == 1, ReplicationFactor: 1 == 1.

So here we see that we also compare our own static configuration to our own configuration 😆. The statement itself is nicely readable and it's clear what would be wrong in a failure case. The only thing we missed was an additional space and it might make sense to change the dot into a colon.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                      "Static configuration of node {} differs from local node {}." 
          
          
            
                      "Static configuration of node {} differs from local node {}: "
